hint.text:
Use the laws of exponents:
Law of ExponentsExample
\(x^1 = x\)\(4^1 = 4\)
\(x^0 = 1\)\(5^0 = 1\)
\(x^{-1} = \frac 1x\)\(3^{-1} = \frac 13\)
\(x^mx^n = x^{m+n}\)\(x^2x^6 = x^{2+6} = x^8\)
\(\frac{x^m}{x^n} = x^{m-n}\)\(\frac{x^7}{x^3} = x^{7-3} = x^4\)
\((x^m)^n = x^{mn}\)\((x^2)^5 = x^{2\times5} = x^{10}\)
\((xy)^n = x^ny^n\)\((xy)^4 = x^4y^4\)
\((\frac xy)^n = \frac{x^n}{y^n}\)\((\frac xy)^4 = \frac{x^4}{y^4}\)
\(x^{-n} = \frac1{x^n}\)\(x^{-2} = \frac1{x^2}\)
